verses.verse: Canst thou draw out <WH4900> leviathan <WH3882> with a fishhook <WH2443>? Or press down his tongue <WH3956> with a cord <WH2256>?
Canst thou put <WH7760> a rope <WH100> into his nose <WH639>? Or pierce <WH5344> his jaw <WH3895> through with a hook <WH2336>?
Will he make many <WH7235> supplications <WH8469> unto thee <WH1696>? Or will he speak soft words unto thee <WH7390>?
Will he make <WH3772> a covenant <WH1285> with thee <WH3947>, That thou shouldest take him for a servant <WH5650> for ever <WH5769>?
Wilt thou play <WH7832> with him as with a bird <WH6833>? Or wilt thou bind <WH7194> him for thy maidens <WH5291>?
Will the bands <WH2271> of fishermen make traffic <WH3739> of him <WH2673>? Will they part him among the merchants <WH3669>?
Canst thou fill <WH4390> his skin <WH5785> with barbed irons <WH7905>, Or his head with fish <WH7218> - spears?
Lay <WH7760> thy hand <WH3709> upon him <WH2142>; Remember the battle <WH4421>, and do so no more <WH3254>.
Behold <WH8431>, the hope of him is in vain <WH3576>: Will not one be cast down <WH2904> even at the sight of him <WH4758>?
None is so fierce <WH393> that he dare stir him up <WH5782>; Who then is he that can stand <WH3320> before me <WH6440>?
Who hath first given <WH6923> unto me <WH7999>, that I should repay him <WH8064>? Whatsoever is under the whole heaven is mine.
I will not keep silence concerning <WH2790> his limbs <WH907>, Nor his mighty strength <WH1369>, nor his goodly <WH2433> frame <WH6187>.
Who can strip <WH1540> off his outer <WH6440> garment <WH3830>? Who shall come <WH935> within <WH3718> his jaws <WH7448>?
Who can open <WH6605> the doors <WH1817> of his face <WH6440>? Round about <WH5439> his teeth <WH8127> is terror <WH367>.
His strong scales <WH4043> are his pride <WH1346>, Shut up together <WH5462> as with a close <WH6862> seal <WH2368>.
One <WH259> is so near <WH5066> to another <WH259>, That no air <WH7307> can come between them <WH935>.
They are joined <WH1692> one <WH376> to another <WH251>; They stick together <WH3920>, so that they cannot be sundered <WH6504>.
His sneezings <WH5846> flash <WH1984> forth light <WH216>, And his eyes <WH5869> are like the eyelids <WH6079> of the morning <WH7837>.
Out of his mouth <WH6310> go <WH1980> burning torches <WH3940>, And sparks <WH3590> of fire <WH784> leap forth <WH4422>.
Out of his nostrils <WH5156> a smoke <WH6227> goeth <WH3318>, As of a boiling <WH5301> pot <WH1731> and burning rushes <WH100>.
His breath <WH5315> kindleth <WH3857> coals <WH1513>, And a flame <WH3851> goeth forth <WH3318> from his mouth <WH6310>.
In his neck <WH6677> abideth <WH3885> strength <WH5797>, And terror <WH1670> danceth <WH1750> before him <WH6440>.
The flakes <WH4651> of his flesh <WH1320> are joined together <WH1692>: They are firm <WH3332> upon him <WH4131>; They cannot be moved.
His heart <WH3820> is as firm <WH3332> as a stone <WH68>; Yea <WH3332>, firm as the nether <WH8482> millstone <WH6400>.
When he raiseth himself up <WH7613>, the mighty <WH352> are afraid <WH1481>: By reason of consternation <WH7667> they are beside themselves <WH2398>.
If one lay <WH5381> at him with the sword <WH2719>, it cannot avail <WH6965>; Nor the spear <WH2595>, the dart <WH4551>, nor the pointed shaft <WH8302>.
He counteth <WH2803> iron <WH1270> as straw <WH8401>, And brass <WH5154> as rotten <WH7539> wood <WH6086>.
The arrow <WH1121> cannot make him flee <WH1272>: Sling-stones <WH68> are turned <WH2015> with him into stubble <WH7179>.
Clubs <WH8455> are counted <WH2803> as stubble <WH7179>: He laugheth <WH7832> at the rushing <WH7494> of the javelin <WH3591>.
His underparts are like sharp <WH2303> potsherds <WH2789>: He spreadeth <WH7502> as it were a threshing-wain <WH2742> upon the mire <WH2916>.
He maketh the deep <WH4688> to boil <WH7570> like a pot <WH5518>: He maketh <WH7760> the sea <WH3220> like a pot of ointment <WH4841>.
He maketh a path <WH5410> to shine <WH215> after <WH310> him <WH2803>; One would think the deep <WH8415> to be hoary <WH7872>.
Upon earth <WH6083> there is not his like <WH4915>, That is made <WH6213> without <WH1097> fear <WH2844>.
He beholdeth <WH7200> everything that is high <WH1364>: He is king <WH4428> over all the sons <WH1121> of pride <WH7830>.
